quizData.question: What is unwanted software designed to display advertisements on the screen?
What often uses a web browser to deliver pop-ups or banners to users?
What is seen by some experts as the predecessor to modern PUPs (potentially unwanted programs)?
What tricks users by piggybacking on another program to get installed without them knowing?
What symptom appears when advertisements show up in unexpected parts of the screen?
quizData.answer: Advertisements appear in places they shouldn’t be
choices: Advertisements appear in places they shouldn’t be

quizData.question: What happens when the homepage changes without user consent?
quizData.answer: The Web browser’s homepage has mysteriously changed without the user’s permission
choices: The Web browser’s homepage has mysteriously changed without the user’s permission

quizData.question: What condition occurs when websites you usually visit do not load properly?
quizData.answer: The typically visited Web pages are not displaying properly
choices: The typically visited Web pages are not displaying properly

quizData.question: What happens when links go to a different destination than expected?
quizData.answer: Website links redirect to sites different from what is expected
choices: Website links redirect to sites different from what is expected

quizData.question: What is a sign of adware when your browser becomes extremely sluggish?
quizData.answer: The Web browser slows to a crawl
choices: The Web browser slows to a crawl

quizData.question: What causes multiple add-ons to suddenly appear in your browser?
quizData.answer: New toolbars, extensions, or plugins suddenly populate the browser
choices: The typically visited Web pages are not displaying properly
New toolbars, extensions, or plugins suddenly populate the browser

quizData.question: What system behavior automatically installs software without user action?
quizData.answer: MAC starts automatically installing unwanted software applications
choices: MAC starts automatically installing unwanted software applications

quizData.question: What is a symptom when your browser stops functioning completely?
What infection method silently installs software through bundled freeware?
What tactic hides adware inside programs users believe are trusted or safe?
What attack method redirects users to malicious websites and injects more ads into their session?
What advice urges users to read software terms before installing especially free software?
What practice recommends quitting the installation if something appears suspicious?
What should be avoided to prevent bundled software and risky adware behavior?
What step includes only running known software or apps from verified developers?
What program type is recommended to scan for adware and prevent infections?
What practice suggests scanning regularly to ensure no adware was missed during installation?
What is emphasized as essential to prevent adware using up-to-date protection?
choices: Keep your updates up to date
